docs.title: Welcome to Moil Meeting
docs.text:
Moil Meeting is an innovative video conferencing solution leveraging MoilApp’s high-quality fisheye image processing technology.

It provides panoramic and wide-angle (360°) views using a single fisheye camera.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text: -   :material-camera-iris: **Fisheye Technology**     ---     Processing 360° views from a single camera lens into panoramic views.  -   :material-robot: **AI Tracking**     ---     Dynamic participant tracking features without moving parts.  -   :material-monitor-dashboard: **Multiple Modes**     ---     Original, Discussion, Global, Patrol, and Presentation modes.

docs.title: Documentation Guide
docs.text:
Please choose a topic below to get started:

  • Installation Guide - How to install Moil Meeting.
  • Usage Modes - Learn about different viewing modes.
  • Release Notes - See what's new in the latest version.

docs.title: Configuration Panel
docs.text: The Configuration Panel provides access to all settings and customization options in Moil Meeting.

docs.title: Accessing the Configuration Panel
docs.text: Click the Settings or Configuration button in the control panel to open the Configuration Panel.

docs.title: Camera Settings
docs.text:
Configure camera-related options:

Setting Description Camera Source Select which camera to use Resolution Set video resolution Frame Rate Adjust frames per second Brightness Adjust image brightness Contrast Adjust image contrast Exposure Configure exposure settings

docs.title: Mode Settings
docs.text:
Configure settings for each viewing mode:

  • Original Mode - Basic image adjustments
  • Discussion Mode - Number of views, layout options
  • Global Mode - Field of view, pan/tilt settings
  • Patrol Mode - Speed, range, pause duration
  • Presentation Mode - Presenter area, zoom level

docs.title: Recording Settings
docs.text:
Configure recording options:

Setting Description Output Directory Where recordings are saved Video Format MP4, AVI, etc. Quality Low, Medium, High Audio Enable/disable audio recording

docs.title: Display Settings
docs.text:
Adjust display options:

  • Window layout
  • Color scheme
  • Status bar visibility
  • Full screen options

docs.title: Advanced Settings
docs.text:
Expert configuration options:

  • Camera parameters
  • Processing options
  • Performance tuning
  • Debug options

docs.title: Saving Settings
docs.text:
• Click Apply to apply changes without closing
  • Click Save to save and close the panel
  • Click Cancel to discard changes

docs.title: Resetting Settings
docs.text:
To restore default settings:

  1. Open Configuration Panel
  2. Click Reset to Defaults
  3. Confirm the reset action

docs.title: Exporting/Importing Settings
docs.text:
You can export your settings for backup or transfer:

  1. Click Export Settings
  2. Choose a save location
  3. To import, click Import Settings and select the file

docs.title: Discussion Mode
docs.text: Discussion Mode is optimized for group discussions and meetings, providing multiple views of participants.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Discussion Mode automatically creates multiple dewarped views to capture all participants in a meeting scenario. This mode is ideal for:

  • Group meetings with multiple participants
  • Round table discussions
  • Collaborative sessions

docs.title: How to Use
docs.text:
1. Start the camera and ensure all participants are visible
  2. Select Discussion Mode from the mode selector
  3. Multiple participant views will be displayed

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Multi-view Display - Shows multiple dewarped views simultaneously
  • Automatic Layout - Views are arranged for optimal visibility
  • Participant Focus - Each view focuses on different areas

docs.title: Configuration Options
docs.text: Setting Description Number of Views Adjust how many views are displayed View Layout Choose grid or other layouts View Size Adjust individual view sizes

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Camera Position - Center the camera for equal coverage
  2. Participant Arrangement - Arrange participants evenly around the camera
  3. Lighting - Ensure even lighting for all participants

docs.title: Related Modes
docs.text:
• Original Mode - Raw fisheye view
  • Presentation Mode - For presentations

docs.title: Global Mode
docs.text: Global Mode provides a dewarped wide-angle view of the entire room, ideal for getting an overview of the meeting space.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Global Mode transforms the fisheye image into a wide panoramic view that shows the entire room in a natural perspective. This mode is useful for:

  • Viewing the complete meeting room
  • Getting spatial awareness of participants
  • Overview monitoring

docs.title: How to Use
docs.text:
1. Start the camera
  2. Select Global Mode from the mode selector
  3. A dewarped panoramic view will be displayed

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Panoramic View - Wide-angle dewarped perspective
  • Complete Coverage - See the entire room at once
  • Natural Perspective - Corrected distortion for natural viewing

docs.title: Settings
docs.text: Setting Description Field of View Adjust the viewing angle Pan Horizontal rotation adjustment Tilt Vertical angle adjustment

docs.title: Use Cases
docs.text:
1. Room Overview - Get a complete picture of the meeting space
  2. Security Monitoring - Monitor entire areas
  3. Event Coverage - Capture wide events

docs.title: Related Modes
docs.text:
• Original Mode - Raw fisheye view
  • Patrol Mode - Automated scanning

docs.title: Original Mode
docs.text: Original Mode displays the raw fisheye camera image without any transformation or processing.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Original Mode is the default viewing mode that shows the unprocessed output from your fisheye camera. This mode is useful for:

  • Viewing the complete camera coverage
  • Calibrating camera settings
  • Troubleshooting image issues

docs.title: How to Use
docs.text:
1. Start the camera
  2. Select Original Mode from the mode selector
  3. The full fisheye image will be displayed

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Full Resolution - View the image at native camera resolution
  • No Processing - Raw image without dewarp processing
  • Complete Coverage - See the entire fisheye field of view

docs.title: When to Use Original Mode
docs.text: Scenario Recommended Camera calibration ✓ Testing camera connection ✓ Viewing complete coverage ✓ Active meetings ✗ (use other modes)

docs.title: Settings
docs.text:
Original Mode has minimal settings as it displays the raw image. Key settings include:

  • Brightness adjustment
  • Contrast adjustment
  • Exposure settings

docs.title: Related Modes
docs.text:
• Discussion Mode - For group meetings
  • Global Mode - Dewarped wide view

docs.title: Overview of Apps
docs.text: This section provides an overview of the Moil Meeting application interface and its main components.

docs.title: Application Interface
docs.text: The Moil Meeting application consists of several key areas:

docs.title: Main Window
docs.text: The main window displays the video feed from your fisheye camera with various viewing modes available.

docs.title: Control Panel
docs.text:
Located on the side of the application, the control panel provides access to:

  • Camera controls
  • Mode selection
  • Recording options
  • Configuration settings

docs.title: Status Bar
docs.text:
The status bar shows:

  • Camera connection status
  • Recording status
  • Current mode
  • Frame rate information

docs.title: Application Modes
docs.text:
Moil Meeting supports multiple viewing modes:

Mode Description Original Raw fisheye image view Discussion Optimized for group discussions Global Wide-angle room view Patrol Automated room scanning Presentation Focus on presenter

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
1. Launch the Moil Meeting application
  2. Connect your fisheye camera
  3. Select your preferred mode
  4. Start your meeting!

docs.title: Patrol Mode
docs.text: Patrol Mode automatically scans around the room, providing automated coverage of the entire meeting space.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Patrol Mode automatically rotates the dewarped view around the room, ensuring all areas are periodically visible. This mode is ideal for:

  • Automated room monitoring
  • Capturing all participants over time
  • Hands-free operation

docs.title: How to Use
docs.text:
1. Start the camera
  2. Select Patrol Mode from the mode selector
  3. The view will automatically begin scanning

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Automatic Scanning - View rotates automatically
  • Configurable Speed - Adjust scanning speed
  • Configurable Range - Set patrol limits
  • Pause/Resume - Manually control patrol

docs.title: Settings
docs.text: Setting Description Default Patrol Speed How fast the view rotates Medium Patrol Range Degrees to cover 360° Pause Duration Time to pause at each position 2 seconds

docs.title: Adjusting Speed
docs.text:
1. Open Configuration Panel
  2. Navigate to Patrol Settings
  3. Adjust the speed slider

docs.title: Setting Range
docs.text:
1. Define start and end angles
  2. Set number of stops
  3. Configure pause duration

docs.title: Use Cases
docs.text:
• Meeting Monitoring - Automatically capture all participants
  • Room Surveillance - Continuous area monitoring
  • Event Recording - Cover entire event space

docs.title: Related Modes
docs.text:
• Global Mode - Static panoramic view
  • Discussion Mode - Multi-view display

docs.title: Presentation Mode
docs.text: Presentation Mode is designed for presentations, focusing on the presenter and optionally the presentation materials.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Presentation Mode provides an optimized view for presentation scenarios, typically focusing on:

  • The presenter's position
  • Presentation screen/materials
  • Both presenter and materials in split view

docs.title: How to Use
docs.text:
1. Start the camera
  2. Position the presenter in the designated area
  3. Select Presentation Mode from the mode selector
  4. The view will focus on the presenter area

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Presenter Focus - Automatic focus on presenter area
  • Split View Option - Show presenter and slides together
  • Zoom Control - Adjust zoom level on presenter
  • Area Selection - Define presenter location

docs.title: Settings
docs.text: Setting Description Presenter Area Define where the presenter stands Zoom Level Adjust magnification Split View Enable presenter + slides view Auto-tracking Follow presenter movement

docs.title: Setting Up Presenter Area
docs.text:
1. Open Configuration Panel
  2. Navigate to Presentation Settings
  3. Click "Define Presenter Area"
  4. Mark the area where the presenter will stand

docs.title: Enabling Split View
docs.text:
1. Toggle "Split View" option
  2. Define the presentation screen area
  3. Adjust the view proportions

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Consistent Position - Presenter should stay in defined area
  2. Good Lighting - Ensure presenter is well-lit
  3. Test Before - Verify settings before presentation

docs.title: Related Modes
docs.text:
• Discussion Mode - For group discussions
  • Original Mode - Raw camera view

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: Get started with Moil Meeting in just a few simple steps.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before you begin, ensure you have:

  • Moil Meeting installed on your system
  • A compatible fisheye camera connected
  • Proper camera drivers installed

docs.title: Step 1: Launch the Application
docs.text: Start Moil Meeting from your applications menu or by running the executable.

docs.title: Step 2: Connect Your Camera
docs.text:
1. Ensure your fisheye camera is connected via USB
  2. Wait for the system to recognize the device
  3. The camera should appear in the device list

docs.title: Step 3: Start the Camera
docs.text:
1. Click the Start Camera button
  2. Wait for the camera feed to appear
  3. Verify the video is displaying correctly

docs.title: Step 4: Select a Mode
docs.text:
Choose from the available modes:

  • Original Mode - View the raw fisheye image
  • Discussion Mode - For group meetings
  • Global Mode - Wide-angle view
  • Patrol Mode - Automated scanning
  • Presentation Mode - Presenter focus

docs.title: Step 5: Start Recording (Optional)
docs.text:
If you want to record the meeting:

  1. Click the Start Recording button
  2. The recording indicator will appear
  3. Click Stop Recording when finished

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Explore the Configuration Panel for advanced settings
  • Learn about each Mode in detail

docs.title: Start Recording and Stop Recording
docs.text: This guide covers how to record meetings using Moil Meeting.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Camera must be active before recording
  • Sufficient disk space for the recording
  • Proper write permissions for the output directory

docs.title: Steps to Start Recording
docs.text:
1. Ensure Camera is Running - The camera must be started first
  2. Click Start Recording - Press the "Start Recording" button
  3. Recording Indicator - A red recording indicator will appear
  4. Monitor Status - The status bar shows recording time

docs.title: Recording Settings
docs.text:
Before starting a recording, you may want to configure:

  • Output directory
  • Video format
  • Quality settings
  • Audio options

docs.title: Steps to Stop Recording
docs.text:
1. Click Stop Recording - Press the "Stop Recording" button
  2. Wait for Processing - The video file will be finalized
  3. File Saved - A confirmation message shows the save location

docs.title: After Recording
docs.text:
• The recording is saved to your configured output directory
  • Default format is typically MP4 or AVI
  • Check the file to ensure recording was successful

docs.title: Recording Tips
docs.text:
1. Test Before Important Meetings - Always do a test recording first
  2. Check Disk Space - Ensure sufficient storage before long recordings
  3. Monitor Performance - Recording may impact system performance
  4. Use Quality Settings - Adjust quality based on your needs

docs.title: Recording Won't Start
docs.text:
• Verify camera is active
  • Check disk space
  • Verify write permissions
  • Review output path settings

docs.title: Recording Quality Issues
docs.text:
• Adjust quality settings in configuration
  • Check CPU/GPU performance
  • Reduce resolution if needed

docs.title: Start Camera and Stop Camera
docs.text: This guide covers how to start and stop the camera in Moil Meeting.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Ensure your fisheye camera is properly connected
  • Verify the camera is recognized by your system

docs.title: Steps to Start Camera
docs.text:
1. Open Moil Meeting - Launch the application
  2. Select Camera Source - Choose your camera from the dropdown menu
  3. Click Start Camera - Press the "Start Camera" button
  4. Wait for Initialization - The camera feed should appear within a few seconds

docs.title: Start Camera Button
docs.text:
The Start Camera button is located in the control panel. When clicked:

  • The button label changes to "Stop Camera"
  • The camera feed begins streaming
  • The status bar shows "Camera Active"

docs.title: Steps to Stop Camera
docs.text:
1. Click Stop Camera - Press the "Stop Camera" button
  2. Confirm Stop - The camera feed will stop immediately
  3. Status Update - The status bar shows "Camera Inactive"

docs.title: When to Stop the Camera
docs.text:
• When ending a meeting
  • When switching cameras
  • When troubleshooting camera issues

docs.title: Camera Not Starting
docs.text:
• Check USB connection
  • Verify camera drivers are installed
  • Restart the application
  • Try a different USB port

docs.title: Camera Feed Is Black
docs.text:
• Ensure the camera lens cap is removed
  • Check lighting conditions
  • Verify camera settings in configuration panel

  • Discussion Mode for group meetings
  • Global Mode for wide-angle views
  • Patrol Mode for automated scanning
  • Presentation Mode for presenter focus

  • Recording functionality
  • Configuration panel

docs.title: Changed
docs.text: • N/A

docs.title: Fixed
docs.text:
• N/A

The format is based on Keep a Changelog, and this project adheres to Semantic Versioning.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Welcome to Moil Meeting! This guide will help you get started quickly.

docs.title: Quick Start Guide
docs.text:
1. Install Moil Meeting - Follow the installation guide for your operating system
  2. Connect Your Camera - Ensure your fisheye camera is properly connected
  3. Launch the Application - Start Moil Meeting from your applications menu
  4. Configure Camera - Set up your camera parameters in the configuration panel
  5. Start Meeting - Begin your meeting using the available modes

docs.title: Setting Up Your Camera
docs.text:
Before using Moil Meeting, make sure your fisheye camera is:

  • Properly connected to your computer
  • Recognized by the operating system
  • Configured with the correct parameters

docs.title: Choosing a Mode
docs.text:
Moil Meeting offers several modes for different scenarios:

  • Original Mode - View the raw fisheye image
  • Discussion Mode - Optimized for group discussions
  • Global Mode - Wide-angle view of the entire room
  • Patrol Mode - Automated scanning of the room
  • Presentation Mode - Focus on presenter and slides

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Explore the Modes section to learn about each mode
  • Check the Operations Guide for detailed instructions

docs.title: Upgrade Notes
docs.text: This section provides important notes for upgrading from previous versions of Moil Meeting.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Ensure you have backed up your configuration files
  • Check system requirements for the new version

docs.title: Breaking Changes
docs.text: • None at this time

docs.title: Migration Steps
docs.text:
1. Back up your existing installation
  2. Download the latest version
  3. Follow the installation guide
  4. Restore your configuration files

docs.title: Version Compatibility
docs.text: From Version To Version Notes 1.x 2.x Full compatibility

docs.title: Moil Meeting Of Usage
docs.text: This section provides comprehensive guidance on how to use Moil Meeting effectively.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
Moil Meeting is a powerful video conferencing application that leverages fisheye lens technology to provide immersive meeting experiences. This guide covers:

  • Basic operations and controls
  • Camera management
  • Recording features
  • Mode configurations

docs.title: Quick Navigation
docs.text:
• Operations of the Moil Meeting - Learn how to operate the application
  • Quick Start - Get started quickly
  • Camera Controls - Manage camera operations
  • Recording - Record your meetings

docs.title: Usage Tips
docs.text:
1. Before Starting - Ensure your fisheye camera is properly connected
  2. Choose the Right Mode - Select the mode that best fits your meeting scenario
  3. Configure Settings - Adjust settings in the configuration panel for optimal performance
  4. Test Recording - Test recording functionality before important meetings
